analysis.Overall Analysis: Meenakshy S has a strong educational background with a current pursuit of Btech in Computer Science Engineering with a focus on Artificial Intelligence. She possesses a comprehensive skill set that includes Python, machine learning, deep learning, SQL, and data structures. Her projects demonstrate her ability to apply these skills in practical scenarios such as Alzheimer's disease detection and abusive text detection.

Relevant Projects.Description: Developed a comprehensive framework for early Alzheimer's disease detection by preprocessing EEG signals with wavelet-based adaptive filtering to reduce noise and artifacts. Extracted and integrated features from time domain, frequency domain, and time-frequency domain to create a robust signal representation. Implemented a CNN-based classification model to analyze EEG signals and achieve high diagnostic accuracy through advanced machine learning techniques.

Relevant Projects.Project Name: Abusive Tamil and Malayalam Text Detection
Relevant Projects.Description: developed a deep learning model to detect abusive comments in Tamil and Malayalam from YouTube. Used XLM-RoBERTa embedding.

analysis.Overall Analysis: Krishna Bhagat appears to be a skilled Computer Science student with a strong background in programming languages, particularly Java. He has some experience with Python but lacks hands-on experience in SQL, machine learning frameworks (scikit-learn, TensorFlow), and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib) which are crucial for a Data Scientist role. Additionally, Krishna has worked on projects but they seem to be more focused on software development rather than data science.
